sense.def: Alternative Names yan xiao 鹽哮 , xian hou 咸齁 , xian xiao 咸 . Pathological Condition of xiao chuan 哮喘 , roaring panting, brought forth by a consumption of excessively salty beverages and food. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry wu jiu mu 烏桕木 quotes Zhai xuan fang 摘玄方 : 鹽齁痰喘：桕樹皮去粗搗汁，和飛麺作餅烙熟。早辰與兒吃三四個，待 吐下鹽涎乃佳 , “ Salt roaring with phlegm panting: Remove the coarse parts from the jiu tree bark and pound to prepare juice. Mix this with loose flour and bake to cakes. Have the child eat three or four in the morning. Once it spits and discharges salty saliva it will be fine”. Yan hou bi se 咽喉閉塞 , throat closure [2]

Illness Sign of an inability to drink and eat because of an impassability of the throat resulting from a local swelling, muscle spasm, or an occlusion due to the presence of a foreign object. Qian jin bei ji fang 千金備急方 7: 若毒氣甚，咽喉閉塞不能嚥者，折齒納葱 葉口中，以膏灌葱葉中令下 , “In case of a severe presence of poison qi, when throat closure prevents swallowing, break one tooth out and insert an onion leaf [through the resulting opening] into the mouth. Then instill the [semi-liquid] paste through the leaf. This will make [the throat] move [food] down”.
